intro: Cyrtandra widjajae, commonly known as the Java Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra widjajae is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
